oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On the timing channel in a queue inferencing setting
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MANJUNATH, D
BHASKARAN, SR
VIJAYVERGIYA, G
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: transactional data
engine
timing channel capacity
mutual information rate
queue inferencing
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Queue inferencing is the estimation of the waiting times from the transactional information of a queue, i.e., from the busy periods and service times. There are similarities between queue inferencing and decoding over a timing channel in a packet communication link. We analyze the timing channel achievable rates in the queue inferencing setting for continuous time queues with vacations and for discrete time queues.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: 2010 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON SIGNAL PROCESSING AND COMMUNICATIONS (SPCOM),-
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: International Conference on Signal Processing and Communications,Bangalore, INDIA,JUL 18-21, 2010
